intro: Sterculia lurida, commonly known as the rough-stemmed sterculia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, often hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Sterculia lurida is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments.
